channel.title: .bat files in ubuntu
channel.description:
hi. this may be a noob question but i have never figured this out. is there any way i can run .bat files in ubuntu? like a runescape private server or something like that. if there is possible how? please answer b4 tomorrow because tomorrow we are going to turkey.
and sorry my bad english. im 13 years and lives in norway :)

item.title: .bat files in ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:340155”][quote author=kneistol link=topic=436530.msg3207291#msg3207291 date=1273924242]
heres what i get when i open with gedit

[code]@echo off

color 0a

title Initializing

start english.bat

cls

exit[/code]

how can i make it run as a script then?
[/quote]
so your script basically runs another script. post the other script…[/quote]

lol

Read full topic

item.title: .bat files in ubuntu

item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:1, topic:340155”]hi. this may be a noob question but i have never figured this out.
is there any way i can run .bat files in ubuntu? like a runescape private server or something like that.
if there is possible how?
please answer b4 tomorrow because tomorrow we are going to turkey.

and sorry my bad english. im 13 years and lives in norway :)[/quote]
I don’t think running batch files on Ubuntu is possible but try opening it in txt and see what the code is intended to do then run it as script.

[size=1pt]windows ftw[/size]

Read full topic
